intro: Tetramerium butterwickianum, commonly known as the butterwick tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe. Tetramerium butterwickianum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
